messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] info on unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: I m sorry.  I had responded to that post privately and had intended to delete it from the queue, but I forgot and went away for the weekend and another
messages.messageBody:
I'm sorry. I had responded to that post privately and had intended
to delete it from the queue, but I forgot and went away for the
weekend and another moderator let it through.



This isn't really a good topic for this list, and I've already sent
the mom lots of links to information that's more appropriate.



(I am new to this board, and i am very interested about home shcooling.
Is there any good books to use. I know very little about this subject.
My 2 1/2 yr old twins are due to start nursery next april. I do not
agree with punishments and work hard to try and acheive discipline
through other positive methods. I am not sure what descision i will
make but i know that if the local nursery/school does not treat my
children in a way i would like then i would prefer to home teach. can
any one give me info on this subject ie how to go about it, where to
get all the info etc thanks)



Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
I am new to this board, and i am very interested about home shcooling.
Is there any good books to use. I know very little about this subject.
My 2 1/2 yr old twins are due to start nursery next april. I do not
agree with punishments and work hard to try and acheive discipline
through other positive methods. I am not sure what descision i will
make but i know that if the local nursery/school does not treat my
children in a way i would like then i would prefer to home teach. can
any one give me info on this subject ie how to go about it, where to
get all the info etc thanks

Amelia ( mum to Hamish and Finley born 15/02/2004 id twins born 9 wks
early)
